params.text:
Cloudberries

  • Cloudberries grow in alpine and arctic tundra.

  • The cloudberry is also known as bakeapple, knotberry and averin, and is part of the Rose family. 

  • Each fruit is initially pale red, ripening into an amber color in early autumn.

  • Scandinavia has strict rules for harvesting cloudberries. Sweden even has a section for regulating this in their Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

choices.question: What country has a special section of cloudberry diplomacy in their Ministry of Foreign Affairs
What family of plants does cloudberry belong to ?

metadata.title: What color do ripe cloudberries have?

questions:
The cloudberry is also known as knotberry, bakeapple or *averin*.

Cloudberries can be found in alpine and *arctic* tundra.

params.text:
Redcurrant

  • Ribes Rubrum is the latin name for the redcurrant

  • The flowers of the shrub mature into red translucent berries

  • Berries are 8–12 mm in diameter and have a tart flavour

  • Each bush can produce 3-4 kilos of berries each season

summary:
Cloudberries are also known as knotberries.

Cloudberries are also known as huckleberries.

Cloudberries are also known as gooseberries.

Redcurrant bushes can produce 3–4 kilos of berries each season.

Redcurrant bushes can produce 6–7 kilos of berries each season.

Redcurrant bushes can produce 1–2 kilos of berries each season.

Cloudberries mature into an amber color in early autumn.

Cloudberries mature into an amber color in early spring.

Cloudberries mature into an amber color in late winter.

Redcurrant berries have a naturally tart flavour.

Redcurrant berries have a naturally sweet flavour.

Redcurrant berries have a neutral flavour.

params.text:
Blueberry

  • Blueberries start out with a greenish color, then turn purple and finally a deep blue as they ripe.
  • Blueberries grow in clusters, but the clusters do not necessarily ripen at the same time.
  • Blueberries require a well-drained, acidic soil to flourish.
  • There are over 50 varieties of blueberries.
  • Blueberries have been commercially cultivated since the 20th century

params.taskDescription: Drag colors to match the ripening stages.
params.textField:
Blueberries begin with a *green* color.
As they ripen, the berries turn *purple*, then gradually acquire a deep *blue* color.
